Summoner spell CDR in the talent tree and on lucidity, and a protobelt.

Going down the resolve tree reduces damage dramatically, lucidity vs sorc shoes reduces damage dramatically, and compared to actual full ap items, protobelt reduces damage dramatically. These trade off being able to close the gap, but at the cost of your burst. 

There is a build where you can run protobelt/rylais and be a bit more durable and kill people, but it's nowhere near as bursty as a build that runs Ludens/Void/Deathcap; it's more to play as a disruptor/counter-engager while dealing moderate damage, but it's harder to solo carry games with this build.

If your lane opponent has any knowledge of the game, they're going to buy MR. Their tanks will most likely pick up MR as well. You depend on the Magic Penetration from Void Staff and Boots of Sorcery to maintain your relevance throughout the game from a damage perspective. 

I personally prefer first item Ludens. Movement speed is such an important stat for her.

It's an ultimate minion, but it's an ult that is mainly used for the burst. Hell Tibbers is stronger than Daisy in most situations since Daisy's CC's is delayed, and Ivern doesn't get huge damage from summoning Daisy.

Also Sion's passive will never get him a kill during a teamfight. The most it'll ever do is slap/kill someone who didn't pay attention, or if you're building Lethality against someone low range, you can sometimes kill them too.

> [{quoted}](name=Cant Hold Me Now,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=c8vIWG3r,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2017-05-25T20:20:15.500+0000)

> Also Sion's passive will never get him a kill during a teamfight. The most it'll ever do is slap/kill someone who didn't pay attention, or if you're building Lethality against someone low range, you can sometimes kill them too.

Tibbers has no CC; Daisy can disrupt multiple people with the knock-up.

Daisy's health, attack damage, armor, and magic resist all scale off of Ivern's AP.

Tibbers lasts 45 seconds, Daisy lasts for 60.

Daisy also has a base 419 movement speed, which is faster than most squishy champions even with completed boots. It also automatically takes the Rootcaller dash if you order an auto attack while the target is rooted. A large portion of Ivern's fighting potential IS in Daisy. He can solo epic monsters with it, it can disrupt entire teams. You auto-win 2v2's with it. It's hard to peel off because of it's speed and disruption, but Ivern is also going to be slamming Triggerseeds on it like every 3 seconds..

Annie doesn't play like Ivern. He's not a burst mage, she's not a utility jungler. It IS safe to say that stand alone that Daisy brings more to Ivern than Tibbers brings to Annie, but that doesn't make the respective champions as a whole better than one another.

Tibber's used to have a lot more Burst, and Annie used to be a lot less fun to lane against. They decided to shove off power from the Burst to Tibber's himself, something that can actually be stopped. 

You don't play Sion if you think his Ult is meant to kill someone during a teamfight. His entire kit is disruption, if the enemy focuses him down early in the fight, enemies now have to deal with a Sion and the rest of the team. If he dies later in the fight, he's been soaking damage and laying down CC. 

In laning, the Passive might net you a kill during a gank, or an extremely close trade, but no passive should garentee an enemies death for fighting them.
